text: New competitor drugs challenge Ozempic dominance in the GLP-1 market. Eli Lilly's tirzepatide shows comparable or superior weight loss results in head-to-head clinical trials.

New research suggests Ozempic may have benefits beyond weight loss, including reduced risk of kidney disease, heart failure, and certain types of cancer. Scientists call findings 'promising but preliminary'.
Pediatric obesity experts discuss potential role of Wegovy in treating adolescent obesity after promising trial results show significant weight reduction in teenagers aged 12-17.
Concerns raised about long-term safety of GLP-1 receptor agonists like Wegovy. A panel of endocrinologists calls for more comprehensive post-market surveillance studies.

New study finds Wegovy leads to average 16.9% body weight reduction in clinical trial involving 3790 participants. Researchers at Cleveland Clinic report significant improvements in cardiovascular outcomes alongside weight loss.
Economic analysis shows Wegovy could save healthcare system billions by reducing obesity-related conditions including type 2 diabetes, hypertension, and joint replacement surgeries.
Social media influencers fuel Wegovy trend, posting dramatic before-and-after photos. Mental health experts express concern about unrealistic expectations and body image pressures.
Wegovy manufacturer faces lawsuits over alleged failure to warn about gastroparesis and other serious gastrointestinal side effects. Plaintiffs claim permanent digestive damage.
Counterfeit Wegovy found in multiple states, prompting FDA warning. Authorities seize thousands of fake injection pens containing potentially dangerous substances from unauthorized sellers.

Telehealth platforms make it easier than ever to get Ozempic prescriptions, but critics warn about inadequate medical oversight and the risks of prescribing weight loss drugs without thorough evaluation.

Celebrity endorsements drive surge in Ozempic prescriptions for weight loss, raising ethical concerns among healthcare professionals about off-label use and medication shortages for diabetic patients.

Telehealth platforms make it easier than ever to get Wegovy prescriptions, but critics warn about inadequate medical oversight and the risks of prescribing weight loss drugs without thorough evaluation.
Wall Street analysts project Ozempic sales to reach $17 billion by 2025, making it one of the best-selling drugs in pharmaceutical history. Novo Nordisk stock hits all-time high.
Global demand for Wegovy outstrips supply as countries beyond the US see rising obesity rates. WHO calls for equitable access to effective obesity treatments worldwide.

The FDA has expanded the approved use of Wegovy for chronic weight management in adults with obesity. Health officials say the drug represents a major advancement in obesity treatment options.
